fr.dauphine.robombastic

Interface BotContext

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BotContextImpl

    public interface BotContext
    Context send to a bot by the game. (A BotContext should be unique for each Bot) This interface permits the bot to interact with the game by asking information using info(infoType) or acting using nextTurn(action).
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    remi, florian, benjamin

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  BotContext.Action<R extends BotContext.ActionResponse>
      marker interface of all actions allowed to a bot.
      static interface  BotContext.ActionResponse
      marker interface of all responses retruns by the game.
      static interface  BotContext.Info
      marker interface of all informations provided by the game.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CurrentBotInfo getCurrentBotInfo() 
      GeneralInfo getGeneralInfo() 
      <I extends BotContext.Info>
      I      		 info(java.lang.Class<I> infoType)
      return an object provided by the game that implements interfaces specified by infoType.
      java.util.Set<? extends java.lang.Class<? extends BotContext.Info>> infoTypes()
      Informations interfaces provided by the game to the bot.
      <R extends BotContext.ActionResponse,A extends BotContext.Action<R>>
      R      		 nextTurn(A action)
      Ask the game to execute an action by the current bot.

    • Method Detail

      • getGeneralInfo

        GeneralInfo getGeneralInfo()
        Returns:
        the GeneralInfo object that contains rules about the game.

      • getCurrentBotInfo

        CurrentBotInfo getCurrentBotInfo()
        Returns:
        the CurrentBotInfo object attached to the current bot. (Contains bot specific informations.)

      • infoTypes

        java.util.Set<? extends java.lang.Class<? extends BotContext.Info>> infoTypes()
        Informations interfaces provided by the game to the bot. Theses classes can be used as argument of info(Class) to obtain an object implementing the interface. version 1 of the game required interfaces : CurrentBotInfo, and GeneralInfo.
        Returns:
        a set of all interfaces provided by the game.
        See Also:
        info(Class)

      • info

        <I extends BotContext.Info> I info(java.lang.Class<I> infoType)
        return an object provided by the game that implements interfaces specified by infoType.
        Type Parameters:
        I - type of the interface.
        Parameters:
        infoType - class of the interface.
        Returns:
        an object that implements the interface.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if infoType is not one of interfaces returns by infoType().
        See Also:
        infoTypes()

      • nextTurn

        <R extends BotContext.ActionResponse,A extends BotContext.Action<R>> R nextTurn(A action)
                                                                         throws DeadBotException
        Ask the game to execute an action by the current bot. This method blocks until the action is treated by the game.
        Type Parameters:
        A - type of the action.
        R - type of the response corresponding to the action.
        Parameters:
        action - to performs, this action may be null if the bot just want to wait until the next game turn.
        Returns:
        a response to the requested action.
        Throws:
        DeadBotException - if the current bot is dead.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the action is not a recognized action of the game.
        See Also:
        CurrentBotInfo.isAlive(), CurrentBotInfo#getTourTime()
